required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Impact of an Emotion Regulation Intervention on Emotion Perception

collaborator.agency: Mind and Life Institute, Hadley, Massachusetts

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the impact of a brief, emotion regulation intervention on the ability to perceive other people's emotions.

detailed_description.textblock: Decision to close enrollment was made on January 2, 2020.

primary_outcome.measure: The Ability to Perceive Negative and Positive Emotional Expressions, as Measured by a Behavioral Computer-based Assessment
primary_outcome.description: Emotion perception is measured by a computer-based behavioral assessment during the laboratory session. Scores for negative emotional expressions range from 0-100%, with higher scores indicating greater emotion perception accuracy.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Emotion Perception, as Measured by a Phone-based Behavioral Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: After the one week of phone-based intervention
primary_outcome.description: Perception of positive emotional expressions and negative emotional expressions are measured by a behavioral phone-based assessment, delivered multiple times over one week via mobile phones. Scores for ratings of emotional valence range from 0-9, with higher scores as more positive emotional valence and lower scores as more negative emotional valence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Emotional Distress, as Measured by Subjective Units of Distress (SUDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning of Week one laboratory experiment, End of Week one laboratory experiment
secondary_outcome.description: SUDS are measured on a 10-point Likert self-report scale of Subjective Units of Distress, ranging from 0-9. Scores are changes in SUDS ratings from before hearing the tone to after the tone, with greater scores indicating greater reductions in distress (positive outcomes). SUDS score was evaluated at the beginning of the laboratory experiment, and then at the very end of the lab experiment. The change score was calculated by subtracting the beginning score from the end score.

other_outcome.measure: Changes in Emotional Arousal, as Measured by Skin Conductance Response (SCR)
other_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory assessment, up to one week
other_outcome.description: Changes in emotional arousal are measured physiologically with electrodermal activity. Skin conductance response measures phasic changes in electrical conductivity of skin, with a minimum threshold of 0.01Î¼S with higher values indicating greater changes in emotional arousal.

arm_group.description: Participants receive training in a mindful breathing skill to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders to use this skill, delivered through their mobile phones.

Participants receive an exposure/habituation intervention to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones.

Participants complete the stressor task with no emotion regulation training. Similar to the other conditions, they will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones to test for placebo effects.

intervention.description: Training in a mindful breathing skill that reduces emotional distress
An exposure procedure that reduces emotional distress through habituation

patient_data.ipd_description: Will check with sponsors on Duke's policies for data sharing and may update the plan in the future.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Mindful Breathing
group.description: Participants receive training in a mindful breathing skill to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders to use this skill, delivered through their mobile phones. Mindful Breathing: Training in a mindful breathing skill that reduces emotional distress

group.title: Habituation
group.description: Participants receive an exposure/habituation intervention to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones. Habituation: An exposure procedure that reduces emotional distress through habituation

group.title: Control
group.description: Participants complete the stressor task with no emotion regulation training. Similar to the other conditions, they will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones to test for placebo effects. Control: No emotion regulation intervention, placebo

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: The Ability to Perceive Negative and Positive Emotional Expressions, as Measured by a Behavioral Computer-based Assessment
outcome.description: Emotion perception is measured by a computer-based behavioral assessment during the laboratory session. Scores for negative emotional expressions range from 0-100%, with higher scores indicating greater emotion perception accuracy.
outcome.population: Baseline data for one participant was not completed appropriately and was omitted from the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks. Adverse events were assessed at intake, training session, and exit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
